result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fredy A Pinacho Cruz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Fredy A Pinacho Cruz in court.  Attorney Adam Galaviz in court for Fredy A Pinacho Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter St. John in court and previously sworn. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.  Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Victim filed no contact paperwork. Defendant has not completed no contact paperwork.  Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 329650,
Payable Number: 269818,
Receipt Number: 22R 020680,
Amount: $20.00
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Victim's request to lift no contact
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH. BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY LEONCIO CRUZ.

MUST RESIDE WITH LEONCIO CRUZ. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH G.H.O. dob 2-18-2001 or RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Called at 1:19 PM. Defendant Fredy A Pinacho Cruz in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared for bond purposes only. Record by Attorney Hagerman who does not know if defendant qualifies for SPD. Discussion as to bond - victim is present and makes a statement to the court, does not wish to pursue charges. Just wanted the police to be aware. Record by the State as to bond. Response by Attorney Hagerman. Defendant's uncle appears as to residence and makes a statement. Discussion as to co-signer. Bond set at $10000 surety with $1000 cash component.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
